text.headline: Industrial Revolution
text.text: The period from 1800 to 1900 CE, where significant shifts in labor and family structures occurred.

text.headline: Industrial Revolution
text.text: The Industrial Revolution marked a turning point in gender roles as economic changes began to alter family structures and women’s roles in labor. The emergence of the separate spheres ideology reinforced traditional gender roles with men working in public spheres and women confined to domestic duties.

text.headline: Labor Movements
text.text: Women’s increased participation in the workforce during this period set the stage for future labor movements advocating for gender equality. However, women were often excluded from higher-paying industrial jobs, reinforcing economic disparities.
